{{Infobox person | name = Ed Speleers | image = | caption = | birth_name = Edward John Speleers | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1987|12|21}} | birth_place = [[Chichester]], [[West Sussex]], [[England]] | othername = | occupation = [[Actor]], producer | years_active = 2006âpresent | spouse = | homepage = {{URL|edspeleers.com}} }} '''Edward John''' "'''Ed'''" '''Speleers''' (born December 21, 1987<ref name="tribute">{{cite news|url=http://www.tribute.ca/people/ed-speleers/16471/|title=Ed Speleers biography}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|language=Italian|url=http://i42.tinypic.com/2jfau0z.jpg|title=Il signore dei draghi|date=December 2006|editor=''Best Movie'' magazine}}</ref>) is an [[England|English]] actor and producer. He is best known for playing the [[Eragon (character)|title role]] in the 2006 film ''[[Eragon (film)|Eragon]]''.
==Personal life== Speleers was born at St. Richard's Hospital, [[Chichester]], [[West Sussex]]. His parents divorced when he was 3.<ref name="inquirer" /> He is the youngest son of mother Gill, who lives in Spain.<ref name="tribute" />; his father, John, is a [[financial consultant]] and lives in London.<ref name="tribute" /> He has two older half brothers.<ref name="inquirer">{{cite web|url=http://www.popmatters.com/pm/article/eragon-star-edward-speleers-is-on-quite-the-ride/|title='Eragon' star Edward Speleers is on quite the ride|first=David|last=Hiltbrand|date=15 December 2006|editor=The Philadelphia Inquirer|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref> In 2006, he left [[Eastbourne College]] to portrait Eragon.<ref name="tribute" />
==Career== ===Acting=== Prior to ''Eragon'', Speleers appeared in school productions, such as ''[[A Midsummer Night's Dream]]'' when he was 10<ref>{{cite news|first=Suzanne|last= Freeman|url=http://www2.scholastic.com/browse/article.jsp?id=8092|title=Eragon: Edward Speleers|editor=Scholastic.com|date=6 December 2006|accessdate=28 June 2011}}</ref>, ''[[Peter and Wendy|Peter Pan]]'', ''[[A Street Car Named Desire]]'', ''[[Richard III (play)|Richard III]]'' and ''[[Hamlet]]''. While at [[Eastbourne College]], Speleers wrote a play, ''Retribution'', with his friend Rob Curran, which investigated the subjects of [[child abuse]] and [[paedophilia]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.filmwerk.co.uk/?p=6841|title=FrightFest Week â A Lonely Place To Die: Ed Speleers Interview|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>. Speleers also acted in a short film by Charlie Bleakley, called ''Metropolis''.
He then landed the title role of the 20th Century Fox screen version of ''[[Eragon (film)|Eragon]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://teacher.scholastic.com/scholasticnews/indepth/eragon/ |title=Eragon |publisher=''Scholastic News Online''}} in 2006.</ref> In 2008, he appeared in the British prime time series ''[[Echo Beach (soap)|Echo Beach]]'' as Jimmy Penwarden.
In mid 2010, Ed was cast as one of the lead roles in British thriller film ''[[A Lonely Place to Die]]'' directed by Julian Gilbey, a feature film, starring [[Melissa George]], [[Sean Harris]] and [[Eamonn Walker]]. The film was released in September 2011 in the UK<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.blogomatic3000.com/2011/06/16/first-look-at-uk-quad-for-frighfest-flick-a-lonely-place-to-die/|title=First look at UK quad for FrightFest flick 'A Lonely Place to Die'|accessdate=28 June 2011}}</ref> and is due to be released in November 2011 in the US. Ed is part of the up-coming comedy horror film ''[[Love Bite (2012 film)|Love Bite]]'', in the lead role of Jamie, with Jessica Szohr and Timothy Spall. He will be in the movie ''[[A Dead Man in Deptford (film)|A Dead Man in Deptford]]'', based on the [[A Dead Man in Deptford|homonym novel]] by [[Anthony Burgess]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.darkhorizons.com/news/18210|title=Sam Riley is Marlowe in 'Dead Man'.|editor=Darkhorizons.com|accessdate=28 June 2011}}</ref>
Speleers is represented in the USA by Jennifer Rawlings of William Morris Endeavor, and in the UK by Sally Long-Innes of the Independent Talent Group. His manager is Matthew Hobbs at Firefly.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fireflyent.com/management/edspeleers/|title=Ed Speleers|editor=Firefly webiste|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>.
===Producing=== Speleers joined Firefly, a multi-platform production company, in 2009 as [[Senior Vice President]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Firefly Corporate Team|url=http://web.archive.org/web/20101012043115/http://www.fireflycontent.com/about-us}}</ref>
== Philantropy == In March 2010, Speleers became the first ambassador of ''YouthNet'', an online company which provides help and advice to young people aged 16 to 25.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.youthnet.org/2010/03/ed-speelers-youthnet-ambassador/|title=Ed Speleers, YouthNet ambassador|date=10 March 2010|accessdate=22 November 2011|first=Katy |last=Miller}}</ref> In June, his participation to the ''2011 Virgin London Marathon'' to raise funds was announced.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.youthnet.org/2010/07/ed-speleers-to-run-london-marathon-for-youthnet/|title=Ed Speleers to run London Marathon for YouthNet|first=Katy|last=Miller|date=23 June 2010|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>
